caption: Wonderful food and incredible service. Our server, Stefano, was so informative and guided us through our selections. From apps to dessert, which included a delicious grappa, all was delicious. Would definitely recommend!
This place is worth a visit. They serve large portions for affordable prices. Always clean and with awesome atmosphere. Would recommend to others.
The waiter was terrible.

The waiter was terrible. A guy who did not even say hello, rude, did not tell us anything about the menu. Did not explain or answered our questions even though we were the only ones in the restaurant. We ordered pasta and during the middle of the meal He started asking if we were going to finish soon. The chef was the one who brought us the food and was actually very kind with us, talked to us and made us feel welcomed. But the waiter was a complete disaster. Then when we were going to pay He included the gratuity not as optional and said He could not remove it from the bill. Thanks to the chef, but this things makes me not willing to come back to that restaurant again. Do not recommend.
What an excellent service and a delicious meal.

The food (salad, anti pasta, the complimentary breads, & our main dishes..) 5 stars, but nothing, like NOTHING beats the amazing fine-dining attention we received yesterday by Giorgio! Just amazing! Felt like I was in Italy getting the whole experience! The pastas come in great portions and worth taking to go.  The price Is acceptable for the neighborhood & is a totally worth it especially-very fresh ingredients too (I have Italian family so I’m super picky!). Giorgio made sure my farewell dinner with a great friend of mine was perfect! I think I’ll book at the hotel attached next time just so I know I’ll be eating well! (And there were several other diners but  he made us feel like we had it all to ourselves!)  I wasn’t staying at the hotel but my friend was and he said he had the perfect meal before his 3am airport departure. I can only speak for myself...I’ll 10000% be coming back as often as I can when craving Italian. Again thank you so much Gorgio! 10 stars! Can’t wait to try more of his suggestions!  Mawa.
My salmon was cooked to perfection and this was the first restaurant that knows that red wine should be served with a slight chill.

My fiancé & i decided to come to this hidden gem today and let me tell you we were not disappointed. our waiter Gionni, was a absolute delight. He was very, very attentive to our every need always crossing by in the pouring rain which was running through the cracks of the tent to make sure we were okay. At one point my fiancé got up to use the restroom & i guess Gionni heard him ask me if i was going to be okay alone that he stood by my side making sure i was okay til my fiancé came back. such a gentleman i swear. He then treated us to a couple of appetizers on the house & educated us on a really yummy organic bottle of wine that i now see myself getting because of him. His positive & funny attitude is the only reason i see myself coming back. Thank you for a lovely dining experience & we will definitely be back!

Celebrated my anniversary and my daughters birthday tonight.  The food was wonderful and the service impeccable.  The staff was attentive and anticipated every need. I will definitely go back here and will recommend to all my “foodie” friends!
My family and I found this restaurant while we were walking through battery park and I am so glad we did!  Great atmosphere, delicious food, wonderful service, you can't go wrong!
I love it

Trying to impress a woman at the last second can go good or bad depending on where you go. Im very happy I selected this restaurant. The food was great. My fear of outside seating was eased with the convenient set up. And our host Giorgio made us feel very comfortable and was immensely accommodating. I will definitely recommend this restaurant and return in the future.
Excellent experience
My preferred spot for delicious Italian food.
This spot is excellent! Affordable rates, considerable portions and the staff members are constantly very welcoming.
It's ok. Over the top service in a bit of a cheesy Italian way with average Italian food.
Really average to bad. Stale bread. Reminds me of a fake Times Square-like Italian spot.
I attended a work event here a few weeks ago. I was amazed by the elegant private room. Authentic, gourmet Italian food. I absolutely enjoyed my time here and will return soon.
We hit a 'home run' eating lunch here.  Outstanding food.  Superlative and attentive service.
I love this place. The food is great, service is great, so many "extras"! Appetizers, grappa, it's all good!
Top notch Italian food with top notch service.... Excellent place for dinner!
Amazing service and incredible food!
We always have our xmas luncheon here. The food is clean and very tasty.

We stayed in the Doubletree Hotel and so used the restaurant for our breakfast each morning and then also for 2 evening meals. Our experience was very mixed. The breakfast buffet was quite good and the food on an evening was very good. The service however varied depending on which staff were in and how busy it was. We booked a table for new years eve but when we went in we were made to feel very unwelcome and we were rushed out. That put us off completely and chose to eat at a restaurant down the street the following evening. Some staff hadn't got a clue what they were doing and so service was even comical at times.

Excellent Italian food in the financial district.  Has a small bar and sit down dining.  The interior and ambiance is cozy.  Quick service and great food.  They even have some complimentary grappa for you to try.  Recommend.

(Translated by Google) Deplorable and dishonest service, 😱🤬 Example on sparkling water bottle ... one of three ordered invoiced !!! tip included in the note 📝 mini 20% And as of course - they do not take CB! Only non-negative, the pasta was good. I do not recommend this place  (Original) Service déplorable et malhonnête, 😱🤬 Exemple sur bouteille d’eau gazeuse... une de commandée trois de facturées !!! pourboire inclus dans la note 📝 mini 20% Et comme bien entendu 🙄 ils ne prennent pas la CB ?! Seul point non négatif,  les pâtes étaient bonnes. Je ne recommande pas cet endroit
Attentive service. Food was pretty good.
(Translated by Google) Good food  (Original) Buena comida
Great service, great food and great place.
Great gem of a restaurant! Huge portions are great for sharing, nice atmosphere for a date or hosting out-of-town guests.
Delicious Italian cuisine.

(Translated by Google) This site is ideal. It has everything, the waiters are very nice, they are super outstanding, they are very friendly, it is a pleasure to have dinner here. In addition the food is exquisite, I have repeated in this place in my travels and I do not get tired.  (Original) Este sitio es ideal. Lo tiene todo, los camareros son muy agradables, están súper pendientes, son muy amables, es un placer cenar aquí. Además la comida está exquisita, he repetido en este lugar en mis viajes y no me canso.
Pretty good American Italian. Pasta was good, but I had better.
Bad food
Went here for lunch with a friend. Great service, food, and wine selection. Would definitely return soon!!!

Excellent food! Amazing vibe!! I had Cheese Ravioli with pink sauce (marinara and light cream) and the sauce was very silky and had a great quality and taste!! Too yummy!! My sis had a veggie pesto gnocchi and it was SO good too!! Didn’t get the chewy taste which usually accompanies a gnocchi dish; this one was made to perfection!! Friends had chicken pesto penne pasta and salmon which were yummy by their review!! Service was excellent; we were hard pressed for time since we had a flight to catch and they were very accommodating and recommended all the dishes and took care of us!! Overall, nothing less than 5 stars!!

I'm Italian and this place has nothing got to do with an Italian restaurant. Firstly is not ran by italians and dishes are not real Italian ones Secondly prices in the menu are higher than what is shown outside Thirdly they include 18% of tip in your bill Strongly recommended to stay away from this place

If you're going to dine at Atica make sure you can take your time because it's worth it. half of our party had to rush and the two of us that stayed had a truly great experience. The service was absolutely impeccable. Very friendly, very prompt, and very accommodating. The food was incredible. I had the fish of the day and it was absolutely wonderful. The bread and small plates of fried zucchini, meat and cheese, and grilled peppers were a great touch. That bread!!! Highly recommend if you have more than an hour to enjoy the experience.
(Translated by Google) The service lacks friendliness except for the oldest. If not correct.  (Original) Le service manque de convivialité hormis pour le plus ancien. Sinon correct.

My father raves about this place. Every time he goes to NYC on business, he makes sure to have dinner at Antica at least once, so I had to try it.  A quaint, authentic italian restaurant located in the double tree hotel in lower manhattan. The staff are extremely friendly and attentive.  They know exactly when to approach the table, and do all the subtle things to ensure you have a wonderful experience.  Our server was Giorgio, and he was AMAZING.  My girlfriend and I came for dinner at the recommendation of my father.  After mentioning to Giorgio that this was our first trip to NYC and telling him my father recommended we stop here, he immediately recalled who he was (for context, my dad comes here 3-4x/yr).  He was extremely personable and chatted with us periodically throughout the evening.  The food was excellent.  Something that I would expect on the table at a Sunday dinner with the family.  Authentic, homemade italian food.   Finished the night with a homemade Sambvca Grappa, and a personal sendoff from the waitstaff.  Would recommend this place to all of my friends and family.
One of my favorite Italian food spots in Manhattan.

This is a ver bad place to go. The food could be good but they try to scam you with the prices. On the front door there is a menu with some prices, when you ask the menu inside they have different prices with 2 or more dollars higher. The menus doesn't have the price of the drinks so when you are going to pay the bill has some higher values. I personally ask the price of the coke they said 4 dollars. When I receive the bull it was 4.50 dollars. The menu inside the shop says it has an extra fee of 18% (which I think it is totally out of place) but when I received the bill it was calculated as a 25%!! They are scammers
Average food and experience for the price you pay!
Excellent authentic Italian!
Great service, food & atmosphere
Giorgio and Staff were terrific! Extremely attentive to every detail made for an outstanding dining experience! Will return for sure.

(Translated by Google) Very badly expensive and of regular quality, and at the time of payment has saved part of the money and tells us that we have paid less  (Original) Muy mal caro y de calidad regular, y a la hora de pagar se ha guardado parte del dinero y nos dice que hemos pagado de menos
Amazing food great service

The prices provided in the menu inside were ~30% higher than the ones displayed in front of the restaurant. In addition to that the restaurant automatically charges an 18%tip. I find such practices unacceptable so I left without being able to taste any of the dishes and thus cannot say much more about anything else.
Not very memorable

(Translated by Google) Do not go to this place to eat. You're just being ripped off. Fish of the day was on the menu with no price. All other fish were around $ 30. Did not specifically ask how much this fish costs of the day. Other food was not overpriced on the menu. The bill was for a stink normal fish with a mineral water 88 dollars! He was not even made tasty. On the plate was just a fish and a leaf of salad. Complaints were rejected.  (Original) Geht nicht in dieses Lokal zum Essen. Ihr werdet bloß  über den Tisch gezogen. Fisch des Tages stand auf der Speisekarte ohne Preis. Alle anderen Fische waren um die 30 Dollar. Habe nicht spezifisch nachgefragt wieviel dieser Fisch des Tages kostet. Auch andere Speisen waren nicht übertrieben teuer auf der Speisekarte zu finden. Die Rechnung betrug für einen stink normalen Fisch mit einem Mineralwasser 88 Dollar! Er wurde nicht mal schmackhaft zubereitet. Auf dem Teller war nur ein Fisch und ein Blatt Salat. Reklamationen wurden abgelehnt.
Used to be good.
We had a wonderful dining experience. The food was amazing and the service was way above board

Had lunch there. Delicious gratis amuse-bouches of sauteed zucchini, hot roasted peppers,sopressata and parmesan with fresh bread tray. Gracious service, and Antica Salad was crisp and tasty. Glass of Chianti was full-bodied and satisfying. Background music was Classical and enhanced the dining experience. Main course of cappellini with shrimps, artichokes and cherry tomatoes was well balanced and delicious, generous enough to take some home. Only drawback was that other people like the place too and by the time we left it was packed and the noise level had risen somewhat.
Food was delicious 🍝😋

Coming from one world trade center, we decided to eat some Italian food and got to Antica, the were us and another table.  The waiter was only taking care of the other table and sent the busboy that barely speaks English to serve us ! Food was very good ! Service was terrible ! At the end the included in our bill a 20% service charge, maybe common in NY. Never again This was 06/14/2019 @ 4pm
Food is of course great. Their service is amazing excellent.

Def best Italian food I ever had! And what it makes me saying the best was service too! Or waiter name was Leridon (Stefani) He took care of us like we our his best friends! Before the food comes to table, They served parmesan chunks and salami with fresh bread and butter and fried zucchini before we even order anything! And we ordered carbonara and gnocchi both were excellent! Interior is pretty romantic too and perfect for date night
Stale bread, pasta which was fine but nothing special, and an ambiance which is also fine but nothing special. The service was also fine but nothing special. The ravioli of the day was very good.

Lovely dinner at Antica.  The food was perfect - from the tricolore salad set in a delicate cucumber ring to the perfectly cooked salmon, everything was flavorful and cooked to perfection.  The diner next to me ordered a caesar salad that was made table side.   On top of the delicious meal I have to commend the staff who truly made my meal special.  Sometimes eating out alone on a work trip can feel isolating.  Not here - the staff, especially Giogio, made me feel welcome and relaxed.  A great choice for many types of occasions.

We made a last minute dinner reservation for 8 including a toddler. The food and service were wonderful. Stefano was very attentive. He made sure our granddaughter was well taken care of. The lobster bisque special was delicious. The bronzini fish special was prepared tableside. The rigatoni Bolognese was delicious. The ravioli special was also very good. Everyone enjoyed their meals. Stefano personally let our granddaughter select a dessert on the house. We could not have asked for a lovelier family gathering.
Great service
The food was absolutely delicious!
Food was amazing, and service was great!
Great place
Great food and a great atmosphere.
Fabulous!
Been going there for years. It's home away from home.
Exceeded our expectations. Phenomenal service from everyone working. Gluten free dish expertly prepared. One of the best dining experiences I’ve had in NYC.

I stayed at the DoubleTree and went for breakfast. The food and decor are mediocre, but the service is the worst. My server was Bessa.  Awful attitude. She never checked on us until it was time for the bill. When we recieved our check, we realized she told us the wrong amount for brunch. She quoted $17 when it was closer to $25. She blamed my partner and I, lied and said she mentioned no price and that we can check the menu...which she never gave us. We later gave a voucher and she became even more irrate.  To be fair, the other servers helped us a great deal. They were kind, professional and attentive.  Stay clear of Bessa, and you should do just fine.
Really good food and attentive service while being reasonable.

Nice place. The food is not really Italian. Minestrone soup was unusual, a lot of spinach. Spaghetti carbonara were not bad, but with green peas. In general, an amateur. Good service. Them brought a variety of snacks as a compliment.

The food was so great, the service was so stupendous that I had to post this review while still enjoying the ambiance and wine.  A special shoutout to Giorgio who went beyond the call of duty which shouldn't be stated here.
Excellent food served perfectly 👍
Fantastic small gem.

Very cozy and delicate hidden gem in financial district. Came here for lunch with my coworker and our server (as well as others) was super friendly and helpful. They gave us three free sample dishes and introduced the daily specials to us. Very pleasant experience. Strongly recommend.
Excellent service and food ! Best Italian in Lower Manhattan
High-end old school Italian restaurant, food is exceptional.
Wonderful food and service!  They went out of the way to make us feel special.  Also, great Italian music playing.  I would come back many times!
My go to place in downtown.  Awesome service and food.   Great wine list
Very nice, not too expensive. Antipasto course was great with very tasty Italian peppers. the poached Branzino was delectable.
Great food altho a bit pricey.  Homemade pasta was awesome and zucchini appetizer was incredibly delicious
Lamb chops  raw cooked. Chocolate moose was great. Fish was good... waiters too noisy... shouting...no halal food.

My son and I wanted a place close to our hotel after a full and exhausting day in the city. Antica was a nice surprise! The food was great and the service was even better (thank you Georgio!).  I also asked for a glass of wine to take to my room which they were happy to provide. I would eat here again!
Great service, absolutely great staff and incredible meals. Highly recomend to visite. Promiss you’ll enjoy it100%. Special thanks to Georgip has been amazing !!!!!!
Awesome Italian place totally recommend
Pricey, but the food was SOOO good! Staff was friendly and the food came out fast! 😊
Delicious, authentic Italian food. Mouthwatering steaks.
Great food and service

We read great reviews and expected a lot. The waiter was initially okay but as soon as a group of four women showed up he was all over them. We overheard him telling to be from Albania and more trying to impress stuff. The food was okay but for sure not spectacular. Arugula salad was below par, the mushrooms and artichoke had hard undercooked bitter tasting pieces. Chicken Marsala was good. Pasta did not taste freshly made and sauce tasted watered down.  When we finally got got waiter’s attention we asked for the bill. It turned out to be less than the voucher we had. So we gave him the voucher which also covered a significant part of the gratuity. He then let us wait for several minutes to add some gratuity. We got fed up and left.  Whilst waiting for the elevator he suddenly jumped on us and telling us we had to give him more. We did not like that behaviour. He then left threatening us to make sure that we would not get any of our incidental credit card hold back from the associated hotel.  My wife left really uncomfortable.  Do NOT threaten me as I will not tolerate that.  The place is aiming for hotel guests and maybe they accept the quality of the food but I’d rather go next door to Irish pub Murphy’s where they serve you better food for a fraction of the price.  If you are after great Italian food, look beyond as Manhattan has numerous places that will offer you real Italian quality food.
Good food.

My  girlfriends and I were staying at the Double Tree right next door. We were exhausted and decided to order from Antica's. Being that it was extremely convenient being right downstairs from our room. You would think they would have some sort of arraignment with the hotel for room service or would delivery... I mean after all it is in the same building but NO. Not a big deal we ran down and grabbed and rushed back to the room. The food was amazing!!! I loved my cheese ravioli alla vodka. The person taking our order thought I had three heads when I asked for chicken with it, but either way it was delicious!! my girlfriends also loved their entrees too.  Between flavor portion and freshness it was great.
This place was overwhelmingly fancy for the price. All the staff greeting us very warmly. The waiter was very knowledgeable and helpful. Would definitely like to return.
Great Food, Great Staff
The food was very good. The wait staff is friendly.
Food and staff were both wonderful! Great experience.  Would definitely go again.
The service was excellent and on point. We ordered fried calamari which was very tasty. The restaurant was quiet and elegant. Great first date place to go :)
Very poor service by Arbi A, treated us rudely. Was inconvenienced to seat us. Food was good but I wouldn't spend money here again since service is much better at many other restaurants

The food and service here is really unbelieveable.  Never is a let down. It's a high end Italian Restauran that you remember growing up, but with better food and legit Italian imports running the place.  The only issue is the restaurant being on the ground floor of a doubletree hotel.  You don't feel like it's connected to the budget,  touristy Doubletree until you have to use the restrooms on the 2nd floor of the hotel.  Otherwise, would give  it 5 stars.

5 stars for the service! Went for lunch. Had the Snapper in white wine and lemon sauce. A little bland but very good. Entre was appropriately priced but they asked "would I like some vegetables with it" I said yes and spent $8.00 for a little plate of Spinach with garlic. To their credit, there was a complimentary plate of a little salumi and parmigiana regianno chunks gratis and they offered a homemade drink with dessert. I would go back.
Completely one of the worst service ever experienced, the food couldn’t even make up for it
Food is only surpassed by service.

I won’t even stop to find out whether or not a reservation is necessary to eat here. The entire encounter was off-putting. My mother, sister and I were staying at the Doubletree which is upstairs this place. My mother wasn’t feeling well because she had a long flight. It’s important to know we’re three black women. Upon entering this establishment, we were approached by the Maître d’. The one with the gap in his teeth. Before he approached us I saw the reservation book and there were THREE NAMES in the book. He came over and asked if we had a reservation. We said no. He said he can’t seat us because it’s all booked. There were empty tables outside AND in! So, we had to leave. I made it a point of duty to record the name of this place. They’ll never get my business. Ever.

Went here on our second trip to NYC. The head waiter and assistant waiters were extremely attentive. The portions were big, and honestly in comparison with other restaraunts, even chains, relatively low-priced. Quality was out of the park with all homemade dishes. If you go, order the tiramisu, hands down the best tiramisu I’ve ever had, and probably ever will.
A Perfect  experience. The best "rigatoni a la bolognesa" I have ever eaten. Amazing team. Tips are included in the final price. A little expensive.
Ask for Andy! He is so sweet and gives great service. Food is good, but Andy makes it worth while.
(Translated by Google) Great Wall Street Italy  (Original) Grande la Italia de wall street
An authentic Italian restaurant. Delicious food and very great service. Pollo Martini was just awesome.
(Translated by Google) Very good kitchen, prices moderate  (Original) Sehr gute Küche, Preise moderat
Food was delicious! Beautiful atmosphere! Service was great, especially Georgio!
Great waiter and food was awsome
Great atmosphere.
Great and an amazing staff
Loved this place. Was there for business lunch, the highlight was they has the huggest pepper mill like 6 ft huge. FYI - their portions are huge.
Absolutely fantastic service and dining. Some of the best, classic Italian food I've ever eaten. Try the handmade ravioli - if it's available. Also, the grilled calamari was fantastic!
Great service and real Italian food
Excellent food and impeccable service. Giorgio is very personable as well as the rest of the staff.  Prices are really reasonable.

We had reservations at another restaurant only to find out they canceled the reservation without even telling us. I called and made a reservation at the last minute. Stefano and the rest of the staff gave us a great dining experience and the food was great! Will definitely be back.

Overpriced and underdelivers for half that price. Not coming back. Pushy sales/waiting staff. Not a great experience. Worst kind of Italian restaurant. Built for tourist from the hotel above, it seems. Food was mediocre, at best. But, I guess, tourists will keep it afloat.

Just hosted our grandsons baptismal party with 18 family members.  We had our own room and received amazing service from our host Georgio! The food was excellently prepared and from appetizers thru dessert the presentation and timelines of food and service was perfect! Highly recommend and suggest you ask for Georgio .
Delicious Food, Ambiance and Service

My husband and I celebrated a milestone Birthday at ANTICA,  . Georgio our waiter and all the staff were wonderful.  The food was tasty and presented well. I would recommend Antica!  You will not be disappointed! I truly believe the person who said this place was terrible, is one of those angry disgusting people that post lies.  Thank Georgio  and staff for a wonderful evening. The couple sitting behind us helped make my Birthday more fun!
(Translated by Google) A great place, we ate very well $ 50 per person.  (Original) Un lugar estupendo, comimos muy bien 50$ por persona..

Fantastic food, atmosphere and service. I recommend the ravioli option, it was $32 that day (varies by what options are currently available) and was absolutely fantastic. Great service once they knew we were going to order more than espresso, I suppose I can't blame them for being skeptical based on my tourist outfit that day. This is a real Italian experience, dont gamble with food in little Italy, pay just a little more here and get way more value.

Very authentic Italian experience!! They actually speak Italian. Very tasty food. Hard to remember what i ordered but certainly  remember that it was finger licking good! Went there with my office colleagues. It feels very upscale and reasonably priced.
another great breakfast
Food is ok, the service is just excellent.
(Translated by Google) food ok butler terribble  (Original) food ok maître d'hôtel terribble
Great food, atmosphere and service. A keepa for sure!
Great service!

Food was “ok”.  Service was just absent. For such a small place you would think they would be all over you. Had to ask for a menu and couldn’t get anyone’s attention to get the bill.  I would go somewhere else, just not good.
Nice place. Food is great so is the service. The Godfather fish Branzino tastes awesome. I like their pepper shaker :). It is huge!
Really delicious food terrific service and nice ambience
Did 30th birthday here. Was fantastic. While food is great, service is prob best part. Waiters are super friendly. All with Italian accents. Had a great time.
Great service, food and friendly staff.
Excellent service, superb menu options and excellent dessert. Penne Arrabiata and Salad Antica are always my staple.
Fantastic food and sincere service. I had an excellent lobster bisque there. The Dover sole was amazing as well. My husband also enjoyed their rib eye steak a lot.
Based on the reviews, I had high hopes that the food would be a ripsnorter, but turned out to be rather "blah" I'm giving it 3 stars because the service was exceptional!
Solid food with great service

The service was very cordial and professional. The food was delicious. The deco and the background music (always in Italian) completed the scenario. It is also very affordable. It was my best restaurant experience in 4 days staying in New York. I very highly recommend this restaurant!
Great place, very friendly management and staff!
Tasty meal and we treated ourselves to chocolate mousse. Attentive service.
Absolutely fantastic. The food was amazing. The staff (especially Gorgio) treated us like family.
Really great service and comfortable place for business

Truly excellent experience. I admit that I arrived during an off peak time (2:30 on a Sunday) and I was the only patron, but it was a truly marvelous experience. I am moderately allergic to wheat, but I rarely mention it because it's something I'm good at managing on my own. When I refused the bread, withininutes they'd provided two wonderful options to my table: fried zucchini (not breaded) and a cheese and meat plate. The fact that they did this without my asking revealed an attentiveness that's rare in the industry as a whole.  I ordered one of the appetizer specials, which were sea scallops swimming in a lightly spicy tomato and pepper marinara that exquisite. The scallops we're perfectly cooked and the marinara was a perfect complement. I also ordered the veal marsala (the veal did not look breaded at all). This is my only mark against them. Admittedly, marsala is a difficult thing because everyone has their own opinion. Some prefer sweet, others prefer savory, and some prefer marsala that reveals a stronger alcoholic undertone. My only complaint is that this marsala did none of these things. It was a complete middle of the road experience. So, that was disappointing, but the veal was tender, not overcooked, and there was just the right amount of sauce (it was neither swimming nor dry).  Overall, I had an excellent experience. Perfect service with excellent food. While the marsala wasn't exceptional in any way, it wasn't disappointing and I've had many disappointing experiences with marsala dishes.

(Translated by Google) An Italian restaurant run by people from Eastern Europe. I have seen comments from Americans saying that the best thing is that they are "real Italians", but that is not the case. I ate a pasta with salmon that tasted very strong and a burrata that was good. The price seemed a little expensive for what they offer.  (Original) Um restaurante italiano tocado por pessoas do leste europeu. Já vi comentários de americanos dizendo que o melhor é que eles são "real Italians", mas não é o caso. Comi um macarrão com salmão que estava com um gosto muito forte e uma burrata que estava boa. O preço me pareceu um pouco caro pelo que oferecem.
We wanted Italian so we found Italian. We weren't expecting such great service and excellent food. Greorgio definitely made our night.

Good Italian food, seemed very authentic. Comes with complimentary antipasti (very large portions of peppers, fried zucchini, parmesan, etc) and also complimentary digestif drinks after your meal. Pleasant atmosphere and excellent service.
Great Italian restaurant

Giorgio provided the best old world service I've had in decades. Attentive, yet unobtrusive. The sea scallops were enormous, perfectly cooked, and smothered in a lovely light tomato sauce with fresh basil and just a bit of a kick. Enormous portions! Lively atmosphere, with Bocelli's gorgeous voice accompanying animated conversations. Intimate, white tablecloth, fine dining. I'll be back!

I love this restaurant. The food was amazing, and the service was even better if that can be. The Italian moonshine was really a nice touch  after a lovely meal. Tony and his staff are really attentive, and they seem to know when you want, what you want without you even saying it! I'm not trying to hype this placce up, but great, is great.
All the food was amazing and the staff were nice and attentive.
OMG! This place is incredible. Impeccable service, great food and complementary after dinner drinks.
Good Italian food. Quick service. Easy in and easy out. Convenient location.

Excellent service and amazing food!  Would highly recommend to anyone.  Potentially the best Seabass I've ever had.  The service was amazing and they were extremely fast.  Especially the manager Sammy.  I would highly recommend this place for any meal!

We were staying at the Double Tree and I was on my last night here alone. I wanted some place close that I could get something quick. The waiters were so nice and the red snapper was to die for! One of the best restaurants I had in New York while I was here for the week. Everything was great!

I've been taking clients there for lunch a while now since I was introduced to Antica about 4 years ago. I'm also classically trained in culinary arts. I've never been disappointed in either the quality/freshness of the cuisine or the excellent service I've had every time I'm there. Will I be back? As my favorite matre d'hotel Elio says, "You better believe it..."

This really is a poor place made of italian restaurant cliches. The service was abrupt and not very welcoming. What summed it up for me is when I realised the pasta tasted as it was out of a packet. For the money they charged you'd think they would make it fresh.  Just best to stay away from this one.
(Translated by Google) Italian restaurant but nothing more ... It is not worth the detour ...  (Original) Restaurant italien mais sans plus... Ca ne vaut pas le détour...
Good food and service, the design is a bit old and the place was empty
Great service, great food, ambience is a little dead, looks closed from outside
One of my favorite Italian places in NY. Good wine and a delicious antipasto dish to munch on while you wait.

Had a very lovely meal...lobster bisque, tuna steak and salmon pasta. The complimentary antipasto (salami, cheeses, fried zuchinni and of course bread) was a meal on its own. The waiter Steve was very friendly and attentive. Would recommend having a meal here.

(Translated by Google) Italian? Are we joking? The restaurant has a tasteful decor, regardless of what we decide to stay despite the first impact. We order a simple dish, linguine alla sorrentina accompanied by a glass of wine each, I did not expect anything exceptional but not even that disgusting mush presented to me. Not to mention the $ 85 bill for two overcooked pasta dishes and two glasses of wine  (Original) Italiano? Ma stiamo scherzando? Il ristorante si presenta con un arredamento di dubbio gusto, incuranti di  ciò decidiamo di restare nonostante il primo impatto. Ordiniamo un piatto semplice, linguine alla sorrentina accompagnate da un bicchiere di vino a testa, non mi aspettavo nulla di eccezionale ma nemmeno quella poltiglia disgustosa che mi é stata presentata. Per non parlare del conto 85$ per due piatti di pasta scotta e due bicchieri di vino

(Translated by Google) Of Italian he has only the writing, still they have not learned to write WE FEEL TO COPY BUT WE MISS HIM! Overcooked pasta and just enough, powdery and meaty, price for what you eat very inadequate, better a sandwich  (Original) Di italiano ha solo la scritta, ancora non hanno imparato a scrive TENTIAMO DI COPIARE MA CI RISCIAMO MALE ! Pasta scotta e di fascia basta,  farinosa e pastosa, prezzo per quello che si mangia molto inadeguato, meglio un panino

We should have figured out it was a louzy place from the ugly interiors but we were starving. Visiting New York from Italy me and my boyfriend were tired of street food and decided to have a dish of warm pasta on a cold january day. The reviews were really good for this place so we thought we might get something similar to the real thing also because we have heard that many italians in new york cook authentic italian food . Well, nobody in this spot is italian and we noticed that!... but we had already sat down so we ordered one of the simpliest italian dishes. Fettuccine sorrentina, just fresh tomatoes and mozzarella. It was overcooked and just awful. I have tasted better pasta on planes! Who the hell gave these imposters good reviews beats me! This is a digrace not just to italian food but to good food in general ! VERY DISAPPOINTED.
Great ribeye.
amazing. delicious.  simply perfect. amazing staff, amazing food
Place is OK.  Waiters have an attitude.
Horrible service ,rudest ever staff
For vegetarians, options were less.
Great Apollo dish and peace dish! Would like to come back again : D

I hate this place worst place ever now this place does not even exist to me Service is horrible it's  like their not waiting for you  they are waiting  for  someone else  and because we are russian  they heard our accent and when we complained to manager he said next time we come we could get a free dinner but we said no sincerely your worst hateful customers ever goodbye.
High quality food, great service!
Food was just OK. Not up to the NYC quality I expect for the cost of the meal.
Great restaurant!!
The best food and the owner is very gentle...the food is so delicious
Good food

If I had a chance to give this fine restaurants 6 stars i will I don't no wer to start first " the host the decor or the delicious food " every time i am in downtown I will stop in this place " love love the food " atmosphere and the restaurant exellent job
Excellent food!  Amazing desserts, great atmosphere!
Very expensive, but with wonderful food. They make the dressing for a caesar salad table side, very unique experience.
Everything there was wonderful. My entire party loved their food and the service was spectacular!
Nice place

This restaurant is located at the Manhattan';s famed Financial District. I was very curious about their possibly unique foods and service there. I went there with my friends last month.  I was told the owner of this restaurant is originally from Naples.  We had a stracciatella soup and crab cakes to start, which wre recommended by the wait staff. The soup was good but I thought $9 was really over priced. The crab cakes were excellent (my friends also loved them).  I love seafoods. So, I ordered the linguini with clam sauce. Unfortunately, by considering the Manhattan price, I was not so impressed for this meal. My friend had a salmon dish and he was very happy about it. I really do not like to write this but I thought they have quality control issues of the consistency of foods there.  I have to say they had Brooklyn quality with Manhattan price.  Personally, I will not recommend this place to my friends.
GREAT GREAT Food very nice restaurant, I will go back again. excellent Mr. Elio very nice Man

I went there with a group of friends after having a sizeable lunch elsewhere  late afternoon.  Just a bowl of  Pasta Fagioli which was listed on their menu at $10  sounded just right.  As  Pasta Fagioli goes it was mediocre at best and less than exciting.  What is exciting is when you get the bill and find out that you are going to pay them $19.99 for it especially since most of their entrees are in the low 20 range.. When questioned about the discrepancy  I was told that I was given a "sizeable portion".  At  the minimum it would have been appropriate  for them to give me a heads up that  they were going to  take it upon themselves to "Sizeable Portion" me and the bill.
Great upscale Italian restaurant. Waiter was very entertaining.

Had a business dinner for 8.  Just found through Google Maps recommendation.  It was a great evening.  Head waiter was the conductor of a tremendous performance.  He was NY stereotypical and wonderful.  Food was excellent and reasonably priced compared to other restaurants of similar quality.  Again the performance was incredible.  Dinner Guests still talking about the fun the next day.

After arriving to the doubletree late in the evening, hub and I got a cocktail from Anicas and loved it. The staff was wonderful and friendly. Andrea Bocelli was playing in the background and it felt like we were in another world.
Excellent!!!

Excellent family style service, delicious salad and pasta, and a long list of specials every night. Affordable prices for the quality of food with some dishes like fish and Caesar salad made tableside.
Great local little restaurant.
Great restaurant, wonderful staff. My favorite Italian restaurant in NYC.
I love the food, love the service, love the staff. Thank you for making this a great experience. My favorite Italian restaurant in the area!!!!
Good Italian food and nice staff

I'd been wanting to try Ancora as I understood it to be a long-time downtown establishment which moved to the hotel across the street after Hurricane Sandy. Unfortunately the food was just as bad as one would expect from a Doubletree hotel. Wilted salad with commercial dressing, bland pasta with "pomodorini" (but only a shred of tomato), overcooked fish with an unripe tomato slice and none of the accompanying vegetables described--and this is just the food.  The waiter treated us like we were completely ignorant (perhaps he thought we were tourists) and spent ten minutes describing "specials" that just turned out to be the menu. (We had to ask for a menu, ask to place our order, and ask where the food was--it was 45 minutes before we saw a salad, and this was lunchtime! There are so many staff but it's not clear what any of them are doing.) When the waiter asked (or rather told us) whether we liked the food we could not lie, at which point the owner came out and offered us more food, free wine, dessert and coffee. For this I add one star, but I will never return!
Very poor hospitality....the waiter is looking at skin colour...
I dined many times here while I was in NY. Delicious food! The best sword fish and pasta I had till date.

We dined at Ancora over 3 years ago. We still reminisce about the hospitality (they treated me like a princess)...the food! Well worth the cist of fine dining...the ambiance...like you were truly privy to a secret. If you in the city..do not leave without the experience of this restraint.
So attentive to our dining needs. My favorite Italian testaurant during my NYC vacation. Thank you!!

Nestled away, not far from the Bull in Bowling Green, this Italian restaurant is a gem.  The main dining room is on the lower level, and makes you feel as if you walked back through time, to the day when Wall St. was a bit classier. The service was very good and very attentive. I would recommend you don't even open the menu, as the list of specials is VERY thorough - but listen carefully and pay attention.  I think the prices are a bit on the high side, but the quality of the food more than made up for it. The cheese, salami, pepper, and fried eggplant appetizers that is put out for you when you sit down is also a very nice touch.

At the top of my list!  I placed my order online for a lunch delivery.  I was in the mood for an excellent pasta and just added another random item to meet the delivery minimum.  My pasta dish was nothing of what I expected.  When I read Penne with Fresh Mozzarella, Tomato, and Basil I was expecting a fresh and light dish of Penne tossed with cut fresh tomatoes, Basil leaves in abundance, and chunks of fresh Mozzarella.  It was more like Penne Parmigianna, with chunky tomato sauce, minced basil in the sauce and melted mozzarella  over top.  It's something I don't like and would have never order BUT that is completely my own fault and not a failure of this restaurant!!  The pleasantly unexpected surprise was my random order and the gratis appetizer.  The Panzanela Salad with Gorganzola was absolutely DELICIOUS and completely satisfied my craving for a fresh and light dish!  The included appetizer of zucchini, eggplant, salami, cheese and bread (with spices for some kick and extra flavor) was also perfect.  That reminded me of when I would visit my family in Italy and we were given "a snack" to munch on.  Absolutely wonderful.  Next time I will be sure to order a dish that I cant mistaken (or call my order in)!  I have no doubt that it will be delicious.  Grazie ... Ancora ... hahahaha!!
